channel.title: CVE Feed for Elegant Themes -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Elegant Themes -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-6744|2024-08-02T08:42:07.395Z -- elegant%20themes -- divi
item.description: The Divi theme for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's 'et_pb_text' shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 4.23.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied custom field data. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2023-29099|2024-08-02T14:00:15.880Z -- elegant%20themes -- divi
item.description: Auth. (contributor+) Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Elegant themes Divi theme <= 4.20.2 versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-4490|2024-08-01T20:40:47.362Z -- elegant%20themes -- divi%20builder
item.description: The Elegant Themes Divi theme, Extra theme, and Divi Page Builder plugin for WordPress are vulnerable to DOM-Based Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘title’ parameter in versions up to, and including, 4.25.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level permissions and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-5533|2024-06-18T07:50:40.325Z -- elegant%20themes -- divi
item.description: The Divi theme for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting in all versions up to, and including, 4.25.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level permissions and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
